item.title: [BEAM-7370] Beam Dependency Update Request: Sphinx

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
This issue is P2 but has been unassigned without any comment for 60 days so it has been labeled "stale-P2". If this issue is still affecting you, we care! Please comment and remove the label. Otherwise, in 14 days the issue will be moved to P3.

Please see https://beam.apache.org/contribute/jira-priorities/ for a detailed explanation of what these priorities mean.
This issue was marked "stale-P2" and has not received a public comment in 14 days. It is now automatically moved to P3. If you are still affected by it, you can comment and move it back to P2.

Note pr/11798 didn't accomplish this, we're still using sphinx 1.8.5. From https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_PythonDocs_Cron/945/console which was run today:

11:20:25 py38-docs create: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_PythonDocs_Cron/src/sdks/python/test-suites/tox/pycommon/build/srcs/sdks/python/target/.tox-py38-docs/py38-docs
11:20:28 py38-docs installdeps: Sphinx==3.0.3, sphinx_rtd_theme==0.4.3
11:21:29 py38-docs inst: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_PythonDocs_Cron/src/sdks/python/test-suites/tox/pycommon/build/srcs/sdks/python/target/.tox-py38-docs/.tmp/package/1/apache-beam-2.30.0.dev0.zip
11:24:30 py38-docs installed: alabaster==0.7.12,apache-beam @ file:///home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_PythonDocs_Cron/src/sdks/python/test-suites/tox/pycommon/build/srcs/sdks/python/target/.tox-py38-docs/.tmp/package/1/apache-beam-2.30.0.dev0.zip,apipkg==1.5,atomicwrites==1.4.0,attrs==20.3.0,avro-python3==1.9.2.1,Babel==2.9.0,backcall==0.2.0,cachetools==4.2.1,certifi==2020.12.5,cffi==1.14.5,chardet==4.0.0,crcmod==1.7,decorator==5.0.6,deprecation==2.1.0,dill==0.3.1.1,docker==5.0.0,docopt==0.6.2,docutils==0.17,execnet==1.8.0,facets-overview==1.0.0,fastavro==1.3.5,fasteners==0.16,freezegun==1.1.0,future==0.18.2,google-api-core==1.26.3,google-apitools==0.5.31,google-auth==1.28.0,google-cloud-bigquery==2.13.1,google-cloud-bigtable==1.7.0,google-cloud-core==1.6.0,google-cloud-datastore==1.15.3,google-cloud-dlp==1.0.0,google-cloud-language==1.3.0,google-cloud-pubsub==1.7.0,google-cloud-spanner==1.19.1,google-cloud-videointelligence==1.16.1,google-cloud-vision==1.0.0,google-crc32c==1.1.2,google-resumable-media==1.2.0,googleapis-common-protos==1.53.0,greenlet==1.0.0,grpc-google-iam-v1==0.12.3,grpcio==1.37.0,grpcio-gcp==0.2.2,hdfs==2.6.0,httplib2==0.19.1,idna==2.10,imagesize==1.2.0,ipykernel==5.5.3,ipython==7.22.0,ipython-genutils==0.2.0,jedi==0.18.0,Jinja2==2.11.3,jupyter-client==6.1.12,jupyter-core==4.7.1,MarkupSafe==1.1.1,mock==2.0.0,more-itertools==8.7.0,nose==1.3.7,nose-xunitmp==0.4.1,numpy==1.20.2,oauth2client==4.1.3,packaging==20.9,pandas==1.2.3,parameterized==0.7.5,parso==0.8.2,pbr==5.5.1,pexpect==4.8.0,pickleshare==0.7.5,pluggy==0.13.1,prompt-toolkit==3.0.18,proto-plus==1.18.1,protobuf==3.15.8,psycopg2-binary==2.8.6,ptyprocess==0.7.0,py==1.10.0,pyarrow==3.0.0,pyasn1==0.4.8,pyasn1-modules==0.2.8,pycparser==2.20,pydot==1.4.2,Pygments==2.8.1,PyHamcrest==1.10.1,pymongo==3.11.3,pyparsing==2.4.7,pytest==4.6.11,pytest-forked==1.3.0,pytest-timeout==1.4.2,pytest-xdist==1.34.0,python-dateutil==2.8.1,pytz==2021.1,PyYAML==5.4.1,pyzmq==22.0.3,requests==2.25.1,requests-mock==1.8.0,rsa==4.7.2,six==1.15.0,snowballstemmer==2.1.0,Sphinx==1.8.5,sphinx-rtd-theme==0.4.3,sphinxcontrib-applehelp==1.0.2,sphinxcontrib-devhelp==1.0.2,sphinxcontrib-htmlhelp==1.0.3,sphinxcontrib-jsmath==1.0.1,sphinxcontrib-qthelp==1.0.3,sphinxcontrib-serializinghtml==1.1.4,sphinxcontrib-websupport==1.2.4,SQLAlchemy==1.4.6,tenacity==5.1.5,testcontainers==3.4.0,timeloop==1.0.2,tornado==6.1,traitlets==5.0.5,typing-extensions==3.7.4.3,urllib3==1.26.4,wcwidth==0.2.5,websocket-client==0.58.0,wrapt==1.12.1

Note Sphinx==1.8.5

In order to actually use sphinx 3 we'll need to update setup.py, and also update the version of sphinx_rtd_theme in tox.ini

This Jira ticket has a pull request attached to it, but is still open. Did the pull request resolve the issue? If so, could you please mark it resolved? This will help the project have a clear view of its open issues.
